instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1502 2015 no Wifi, new ribbon and new Wifi Module did not fix the problem
threads.message: We got in a customers Macbook with the WiFi greyed out and we figured it was either the module or the possibly the ribbon that connects the motherboard to the IO board.  We replaced both and tried SMC resets, but still getting WiFi greyed out.....  Any ideas on what we can try next?  Device is not water damaged or shows any sign of damage from the user.

threads.title: A1502 2015 no Wifi, new ribbon and new Wifi Module did not fix the problem
threads.message: Does HDMI, the USB port on that side and SD Card function also not work?

threads.title: A1502 2015 no Wifi, new ribbon and new Wifi Module did not fix the problem
threads.message: They all work.  Bluetooth even works as well.

threads.title: A1502 2015 no Wifi, new ribbon and new Wifi Module did not fix the problem
threads.message: Gotta be a bad WiFi card, I/O Board, or the flex going to the I/O Board. Did you try a new I/O Board?

threads.title: A1502 2015 no Wifi, new ribbon and new Wifi Module did not fix the problem
threads.message: We have not :(  Don't have a spare on hand and this customer wants there device back asap.

threads.title: A1502 2015 no Wifi, new ribbon and new Wifi Module did not fix the problem
threads.message: I would tell the customer to wait and order one if you can. That seems like the issue most likely. Not really a WiFi power circuit on these like on MacBook Airs. Usually, bad I/O Board is the issue.

threads.title: A1502 2015 no Wifi, new ribbon and new Wifi Module did not fix the problem
threads.message:
One time found broken trace on the MLB.
You can check continuity from the MLB to WiFi module pins.
Check for corrosion close to RIO connector.
